annotation.spannedText: Chief Complaint: 24 Hour Events: OGT placed Had Mini-Bal yesterday; antibiotics changed to Vanc/Zosyn + clinda. Low grade fevers 100.1. Coreg was restarted (at lower dose) b/c having mult episodes of NSVT on telemetry.

annotation.spannedText: Assessment and Plan 57-year-old man with history of DM, hypertension, status post CABG complicated by CVA and subglottic stenosis (after multiple intubations), CHF with the EF of 35%-40%, who presented to the ED with shortness of breath & stridor and was found to have a fluid collection in anterior neck s/p tracheal dilation two days prior as well as possible multi-focal PNA. # Airway compromise/Anterior Neck Collection: H/o subglottic stenosis s/p multiple intubations. Has h/o stridor. Underwent tracheal dilation at Mass Eye & Ear on [**7-27**] w/ Dr. [**First Name4 (NamePattern1) 3066**] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 4326**]. Suspect acute compromise in airway is related to procedure; however, no clear findings on fiberoptic imaging while intubating. Per ENT, pt's sridor could be rebound subglottic swelling from recent procedure, however this usually doesn't happen in this time frame. Anterior neck collection may be related to airway compromise given its size. Again, suspect that this collection is related to recent procedure. [**Month (only) 60**] be early infectious collection vs. edema. Not drainable at present. - Continue empiric treatment with clindamycin as well as vanc and Zosyn - brief course of increased steroids to attempt to decrease extent of neck swelling - keep intubated for now; will d/w ENT & anesthesia to coordinate possible extubation today/tomorrow - Monitor neck for increasing size of mass - ENT following # Fevers: Low grade temps overnight. Ddx includes infected neck fluid collection (though does not appear infected on CT scan) versus PNA seen on CT. WBC rising. Pt not currently showing signs of sepsis. - Con t expanded antibiotic coverage as above - culture today - mini BAL # Drop in HCT: pt s Hct was 42 on admission (baseline high 30s), then dropped to 27 after getting IVF. Also, question of blood being drawn proximal to IV being run, possibly causing significant hemodilution. No e/o gross hemorrhage at present, although pt could have blood in ant neck collection. Hct now stable - Trend HCT, appears stable - Guaiac stools # CAD: s/p 5 vessel CABG. CE negative x2 since presentation. No CP. - Restarted coreg, aspirin, will resume statin as well since pt has OGT # CHF/Cardiomyopathy: last TTE in [**6-23**] w/ EF 35-40%. - restart lasix - Con t Coreg; restart lisinopril; hold spironolactone for today #Afib/CVA: in sinus at present. Rate 70s. INR 1.4. Coumadin had been on hold peri-procedure (trach dilation). - holding Coumadin for possible procedure - on decreased dose of Coreg # H/o postoperative polymorphic VT: tx d mexiletine - hold mexiletine for now #DM II: RISS plus lantus (will increase lantus dose to home dose of 32u QHS) # Contact/HCP: Wife ICU [**Name (NI) **] Nutrition: OGT Lines: 18 Gauge - [**2178-7-30**] 07:00 PM 20 Gauge - [**2178-7-31**] 12:00 AM Prophylaxis: DVT: Boots, SQ UF Heparin Communication: spoke w/ wife today about pt s care Code status: Full code Disposition: ICU ------ Protected Section ------ MICU ATTENDING ADDENDUM I saw and examined the patient, and was physically present with the ICU team for the key portions of the services provided. I agree with the note above, including the assessment and plan. I would emphasize and add the following points: 57 yo man with afib, CAD sp CABG complicated by CVA requiring recurrent intubations and subglottic stenosis. Recent tracheal dilation [**7-27**] at [**Hospital 3414**]. Presented [**7-30**] with respiratory distress and stridor requiring fiberoptic nasal intubation. CT neck showed anterior fluid collection. 24 hour events: -steroids increased to decadron 4mg IV q6hr -cuff leak this morning meds: clindamycin 900mg IV q8, vancomycin 1gm IV q12hr, Zosyn 3.375 gm IV q8hr, Decadron 10mg IV q8r, propofol gtt, Exam notable for Tm 100.1 99.2 BP 147/97 HR 65 RR 15 with sat 100% on AC 600/16/5/35% I/O 1700/1600 over 24 hrs Intubated, sedated. Lungs clear anteriorly. RRR, no m/r/g. +BS, soft. No LE edema. Labs notable for WBC 13.5K, HCT 35.9, K+ 3.7, Cr stable today at 1.3. INR 1.6 micro: NGTD CXR with improving LLL infiltrate Neck CT [**7-31**] with persistent supraglottic edema Agree with plan to 1) tracheal stenosis with recent dilation procedure, now with subglottic edema -continue dexamethasone at current dose for now -with cuff leak so likely ready for extubation but will need to have anesthesia (and if available, ENT) services present 2) rising WBC count with fevers -continue zosyn, vancomycin, and clindamycin for now -deep tracheal aspirate and urine culture, blood culture 3) rising Cr 0.7(may be spuriously low) to 1.3 -Cr is actually stable as Cr 0.7 was from diluted sample -resume lasix at home dose today 4) afib with CVA in past -can hold coumadin for now as may need procedures, can resume if successful extubation 5) access -PICC to be placed today FULL CODE Remainder of plan as outlined above. Patient is critically ill Total time: 70 min ------ Protected Section Addendum Entered By:[**Name (NI) **] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 619**], MD on:[**2178-8-2**] 17:02 ------
